thread.title: MENA Golf Tour: Azaan al Rumhy, Ali Hameed eye success
thread.title_full: MENA Golf Tour: Azaan al Rumhy, Ali Hameed eye success

author: muscatdaily@apexmedia.co.om (Muscat Daily News)
title: MENA Golf Tour: Azaan al Rumhy, Ali Hameed eye success
text:
Follow us on MENA Golf Tour: Azaan al Rumhy, Ali Hameed eye success Azaan al Rumhy (third from right) with officials from the MENA Tour, the OGC and Muscat Hills October 19, 2015 
Top-ranked Omani golfers Azaan al Rumhy and Ali Hameed al Saleh will have plenty to play for when they spearhead the home challenge in the Muscat Hills Golf Citizen Championship, which makes its debut on the MENA Golf Tour this week. 
Playing alongside a talented international field will offer the duo a perfect platform to fine tune their game ahead of the Nomura Cup, which will be held at Yas Links in Abu Dhabi, UAE from October 22-25. 
Included in the field, which is represented by players from 17 countries, are nine winners on the tour, led by England’s Joshua White, the 2014 MENA Golf Tour champion, and his compatriot Gary King, who has moved atop the Order of Merit standings following his top-five finish at last week’s event at the Els Club. 
With the first seven events on the 11-stop tour producing a new winner each time in a reflection of the growing talent on show, the inaugural Muscat Hills Golf Citizen Championship, starting on Monday, has the potential to throw up its own storyline. 
Waiting in the wings are a string of regular contenders, especially the English trio of Lee Corfield, Luke Joy and Jake Shepherd, all multiple winners on the tour, and Morocco’s Ahmed Marjan, who will be eager to break back into the winner's circle as the tour is reaching its business end. 
Azaan and Ali Hameed, along with Saudi Arabia’s Prince Khaled Saud al Faisal, will be up against the likes of Morocco’s Ayoub Lguirati and Karim El Hali, who currently lead the region’s amateur division, in what promises to be an interesting duel. 
"We are delighted to be part of the MENA Tour as we support all initiatives that target the overall development of the game in the region," said Mundhir al Barwani, the chairman of the Oman Golf Committee (OGC). 
Mohamed Juma Buamaim, the chairman of the tour, thanked Muscat Hills Golf & Country Club and the OGC for their support in hosting the event. 
Order of Merit standings : Professionals: 1 Gary King (England), 2 Paul Doherty (Scotland), 3 Jake Shepherd (England), 4 Per Barth (Sweden), 5 Thriston Lawrence (South Africa), 6 Ross McGowan (England), 7 Gabriel Canizares (Spain), 8 Luke Joy (England), 9 Stuart Archibald (England), 10 Zane Scotland (England). 
Amateurs: 1 James Allan (England), 2 Rayhan Thomas (India), 3 Ayoub Lguirati (Morocco), 4 Karim El Hali (Morocco), 5 Alex Wills (England). Similar content
